Guest.title: Guest
Guest.description: Represents a guest attending the wedding.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Guest entity.

numberOfAttendees.description: Number of attendees this guest will bring.

dietaryPreferences.description: Guest's dietary preferences (e.g., vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free).

rsvpStatus.description: Indicates whether the guest has confirmed their attendance ('yes', 'no', 'maybe').

additionalNotes.description: Any additional notes or comments from the guest.

Photo.title: Photo
Photo.description: Represents a photo uploaded by a guest.

storagePath.description: The full path to the image file in Firebase Storage.

downloadURL.description: The public URL to view the photo.

uploadedAt.description: Server timestamp of when the photo was uploaded.

width.description: The width of the image in pixels.

height.description: The height of the image in pixels.

id.description: Unique identifier for the SiteConfiguration entity.

storySectionEnabled.description: Indicates whether the 'Story' section is enabled.

venuesSectionEnabled.description: Indicates whether the 'Venues' section is enabled.

timelineSectionEnabled.description: Indicates whether the 'Timeline' section is enabled.

giftRegistryType.description: Type of gift registry to use, either 'external_link' or 'bank_details'.

giftRegistryDetails.description: Details of the gift registry; can be the link, or bank details (account number, bank name etc).

definition.description: Stores guest RSVP information for a specific wedding invitation.

params.name: invitationId
params.description: The unique slug for the wedding event.

params.name: guestId
params.description: The unique ID of the guest.

definition.description: Stores metadata for photos uploaded by guests for a specific wedding. Access is public for reading, but restricted for writing.

params.name: invitationId
params.description: The unique slug for the wedding event.

params.name: photoId
params.description: The unique ID of the photo.

definition.description: Stores the site configuration settings. There should only be one document in this collection. Access is restricted to authorized users.

params.name: configId
params.description: The unique ID of the site configuration (likely a single, known ID).

firestore.reasoning: This design prioritizes security and scalability for the wedding celebration application. It focuses on authorization independence and facilitates simple, robust security rules. We are leveraging path-based ownership for guests and a global collection for site configuration. The photo gallery uses a single collection. No denormalization is required given the authorization model. Access to all data is restricted to authenticated users via firebase authentication.
